page.title: 16The Jubilee Way
page.content: The Jubilee Way is a special walkers' footpath.It was set up and opened to celebrate{Queen Elizabeth II's Silver {Jubilee}in 1977. The footpath starts at{Melton {Mowbray}in Leicestershire and passes though Scalford, Goadby Marwood and Eaton, finishing at{Woolsthorpe}in Lincolnshire, where it joins up to the Viking way.Altogether the Jubilee Way is about 24 kilometres long. The footpath passes through quite a lot of our Block, leading through meadowland and around crops, with many small bridges crossing streams. It is not a difficult walk, so it is very popular especially with groups organising sponsored walks. We have walked part of the Jubilee Walk from School with our parents to raise money for School Funds.
